trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Syncplicity | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Syncplicity | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Syncplicity with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Syncplicity with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Syncplicity
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Syncplicity

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory (AAD) and Syncplicity.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory (AAD) and Syncplicity.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Syncplicity tenant
trans-unit.target: A Syncplicity tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assign Syncplicity access will be able to single sign into the application at your Syncplicity company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the AAD Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assign Syncplicity access will be able to single sign into the application at your Syncplicity company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the AAD Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Syncplicity
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Syncplicity

trans-unit.source: Configuring Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Syncplicity
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Syncplicity

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Syncplicity.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Syncplicity.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Syncplicity, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Syncplicity, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Syncplicity.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Syncplicity.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Syncplicity application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Syncplicity application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Syncplicity, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Syncplicity, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Syncplicity</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Syncplicity</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Syncplicity with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Syncplicity with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Syncplicity application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Syncplicity application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Syncplicity page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Syncplicity page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Syncplicity Sign In URL textbox, type the URL users are using to sign into your Syncplicity application click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Syncplicity Sign In URL textbox, type the URL users are using to sign into your Syncplicity application click Next.

trans-unit.source: The app URL is your Syncplicity tenant URL (e.g.: http://company.Syncplicity.com):
trans-unit.target: The app URL is your Syncplicity tenant URL (e.g.: http://company.Syncplicity.com):

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Sign in to your Syncplicity tenant.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your Syncplicity tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click admin, select settings, and then click Custom domain and single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click admin, select settings, and then click Custom domain and single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Syncplicity</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Syncplicity</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On (SSO) dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On (SSO) dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On \(SSO\)</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On \(SSO\)</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Custom Domain textbox, type the name of your domain.
trans-unit.target: In the Custom Domain textbox, type the name of your domain.

trans-unit.source: Select Enabled as Single Sign-On Status.
trans-unit.target: Select Enabled as Single Sign-On Status.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Entity Id textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Entity Id textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in page URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in page URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout page URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Syncplicity page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout page URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In Identity Provider Certificate, click Choose file, and then upload the certificate you have downloaded from the Microsoft Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: In Identity Provider Certificate, click Choose file, and then upload the certificate you have downloaded from the Microsoft Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Confirmation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Confirmation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to Syncplicity application.
trans-unit.target: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to Syncplicity application.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts in Syncplicity.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts in Syncplicity.

trans-unit.source: To provision a user account to Syncplicity, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To provision a user account to Syncplicity, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Syncplicity tenant (e.g.: https://company.Syncplicity.com).
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Syncplicity tenant (e.g.: https://company.Syncplicity.com).

trans-unit.source: Click Admin and select user accounts.
trans-unit.target: Click Admin and select user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click Add a user.
trans-unit.target: Click Add a user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email address of an AAD account you want to provision, select User as Role, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email address of an AAD account you want to provision, select User as Role, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account Information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account Information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The AAD account holder will get an email including a link to confirm and activate the account.
trans-unit.target: The AAD account holder will get an email including a link to confirm and activate the account.

trans-unit.source: Select a group in your company that your new user should become a member of, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select a group in your company that your new user should become a member of, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Group Membership</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Group Membership</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If there are no groups listed, just click Next.
trans-unit.target: If there are no groups listed, just click Next.

trans-unit.source: Select the folders you would like to place under Syncplicity’s control on the user’s computer, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select the folders you would like to place under Syncplicity’s control on the user’s computer, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Syncplicity Folders</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Syncplicity Folders</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Syncplicity user account creation tools or APIs provided by Syncplicity to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Syncplicity user account creation tools or APIs provided by Syncplicity to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Syncplicity, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Syncplicity, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Syncplicity application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Syncplicity application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
